plugin.tooltip: Editing of game logic, quests, and entities

item.name: &New project
item.help: Open a new project

item.name: &Manage Assets...
item.help: Add, remove and edit assets

item.name: &Manage Resources...
item.help: Manage resources (move, remove, ...)

item.name: &Manage Cells...
item.help: Create and remove cells, set the default cell

item.name: &Manage Dynamic Factories...
item.help: Create and remove dynamic factories and edit their attributes

item.name: &Play Ctrl+P
item.help: Enter game preview mode

item.name: &Open... Ctrl+O
item.help: Open a new project

item.name: &Save Ctrl+S
item.help: Save the current project and all modified and writable assets

item.name: &Save As...
item.help: Save the current project with a new name (doesn't affect assets)

item.name: &Exit...
item.help: Exit Ares Editor

item.name: &Copy Ctrl+C
item.help: Copy the current selection

item.name: &Paste Ctrl+V
item.help: Paste the contents of the clipboard

item.name: &Delete
item.help: Delete the current selection

item.name: &Find Object... Ctrl+F
item.help: Tool to help find objects in the world

item.name: &Update Objects
item.help: Update all objects after making changes to entities or dynamic factories

item.name: &Convert to Physics...
item.help: Convert the current project to using physics (Bullet)

item.name: &Convert to Opcode...
item.help: Convert the current project to using simple collision detection (Opcode)

item.name: &Join Ctrl+J
item.help: Join two objects using a joint defined on the first object

item.name: &Unjoin
item.help: Remove the joint between two or more objects

item.name: &Reset Rotation
item.help: Reset the rotation of the selected object(s) to standard

item.name: &Rotate Left 90
item.help: Rotate the selected objects 90 degrees to the left

item.name: &Rotate Right 90
item.help: Rotate the selected objects 90 degrees to the right

item.name: &Spread Objects
item.help: Spread the selected objects so that their position is evenly distributed between the first and last selected objects (doesn't affect rotation)

item.name: &Align Rotation
item.help: Align the rotation of selected objects to the first selected object (doesn't affect position)

item.name: &Align Objects
item.help: Align the position of selected objects so that the objects become adjacent with minimal movement (doesn't affect rotation)

item.name: &Align Height
item.help: Put all selected objects on the same height as the first selected object

item.name: &Snap Objects
item.help: Put all selected objects at exactly the same transformation as the first selected object

item.name: &Stack Objects
item.help: Stack all selected objects on the first selected object

item.name: &Entity Parameters...
item.help: Set parameters for the entity template specific to this object

item.name: &View Messages Ctrl+M
item.help: Toggle the view of the message pane

item.name: &View Comments
item.help: Toggle the view of the comments pane

item.name: &View Controls
item.help: Unhide the controls pane (after it has been hidden)

item.name: &View 3D
item.help: Unhide the 3D view (after it has been hidden)

item.name: &Online Help... F1
item.help: Show online help in a seperate window

item.name: &About...
item.help: Show the About window

message.name: cel.messenger.action.Message
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will display an on-screen message to the player

message.name: ares.controller.Spawn
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will spawn a new dynamic object in front of the camera

message.name: ares.controller.CreateEntity
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will create a new entity from an entity template

message.name: ares.controller.StartDrag
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will start dragging the object in front of the camera

message.name: ares.controller.StopDrag
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will stop the current dragging operation

message.name: ares.controller.Examine
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will show a description of the object in front of the camera if that object has a description

message.name: ares.controller.Pickup
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will pick up the item in front of the camera if that item can be picked up

message.name: ares.controller.Inventory
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will open the player inventory

message.name: ares.controller.Teleport
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will teleport the player

message.name: ares.controller.Activate
message.description: Usual destination: 'World' entity. This will activate the object in front of the camera. If the object has an assiciated entity then it will get a message of type 'ares.Activate'. If the item can be picked up then it will be picked up. Otherwise the player will start dragging it

message.name: ares.Activate
message.description: Usual destination: any entity. This message is typically sent from the game controller when an entity is activated
